text:
Seven people have been arrested in connection with the burning alive of a 27-year-old woman allegedly by her family members for marrying a man from another caste eight years ago in Rajasthan’s Dungarpur district, the police said on Sunday.

According to the police, the incident occurred on Friday while Rama Kumwar was visiting her family to meet them along with her daughter.

“The woman, Rama Kumwar, after marrying Prakash Sevak of another community, had eloped from her village Pachlasa in Dungarpur district around eight years ago,” a police officer told IANS on Sunday.

“After living somewhere else for all these years she returned to her village along with her three-year-old daughter to meet her family and in-laws.”

‘Family was angry’

“Her brother Laxman Singh and other relatives who were still angry with her [Rama Kumwar], dragged her out of my house. They beat her up and burnt her alive. To destroy evidence, they cremated her late in the evening,” Kalavati, mother-in-law of Rama, said in her complaint.

Ms. Kalavati also claimed to have been beaten up when she tried to save Rama.

“We have registered a case on her complaint and investigations are going on,” the official said.

“So far seven people have been arrested, including Rama’s brother Laxman Singh,” he added. — IANS
title: Seven held for burning Rajasthan woman alive
